I've been watching the Unity3D website for a while now, but just today I noticed a new message.

"Note: Unity 5 pre-order offer ends November 13, 2014 at 13:00 CET"

That notice wasn't there before, it could mean the planned release is upon us in just 3 weeks. Maybe not that day, but I would imagine close to it.

http://unity3d.com/5
As we know, Maxmaps has been quoted saying they would "drop everything" to work on Unity 5 integration.
that's Exciting!!! i cant wait.

So if you're right about when Unity 5 is coming out, it'll more than likely be out before .90.0, do you think they'll proceed as planned then work on Unity or work on a Unity update then go forward with the beta release, or just roll it up in one big update?

So if you're right about when Unity 5 is coming out, it'll more than likely be out before .90.0, do you think they'll proceed as planned then work on Unity or work on a Unity update then go forward with the beta release, or just roll it up in one big update?

Hopefully they'll get the game on to Unity 5 as soon as possible, so pre-beta. Given the acclaimed upsides of the update, it'd be hard to argue against it.

I would not be surprised if the release moving to Unity 5 is a separate release that has few additional features, if any. They don't want to be in the position of having to wonder "Did this break because of the new feature, or did this break because of Unity 5" about every bug.
I can't wait! Even though no release date was announced, it sounds like it'll be coming out sooner than I originally thought!

I would not be surprised if the release moving to Unity 5 is a separate release that has few additional features, if any. They don't want to be in the position of having to wonder "Did this break because of the new feature, or did this break because of Unity 5" about every bug.

True, if it does come out then it should probably be in .90.1.

...what features of unity 5 do you suppose the KSP dev team like so much that the would 'drop everything' to port it over? PhysX 3.3? The new shaders?

My thoughts exactly! While better graphics is always welcome, perhaps its the physics the devs really want. I could've sworn I heard somewhere that Unity 5 had some mystical physics feature that Unity 4 couldn't. N-body physics? I really don't know!

The new Physics engine, yeah, that's what is so exciting. I believe they said that it not only would optimize part physics, but open up new doorways for development.

Someone could probably find the actual post.

I think that it's the new physics engine that makes it exciting for KSP. If I am correct, it allows for multithreaded physics, while currently physics in KSP are single threaded. It will allow for massively larger physics calculations on multi-core processors.

PhysX on the GPU is as dead as EAX. As expected with more open approaches taking over. And in its current state wouldn't have done anything for KSP either way (except fancy smoke particle simulation maybe) see: http://www.codercorner.com/blog/?p=917

PhysX (the CPU bound kind) 3.x is multithreading capable however (in theory) and that comes to Unity5. The migration will be significantly harder than pulling a switch though.

Hopefully they'll get the game on to Unity 5 as soon as possible, so pre-beta. Given the acclaimed upsides of the update, it'd be hard to argue against it.

Hopefully they will not do that, because it would be a terrible idea to rush it like that, extremely bad software engineering practice. KSP should progress with beta 0.90 as planned, running on Unity 4. Unity 5 should come after that, allowing time for Unity to fix bugs in their 5.0 release, and Squad time to do the job properly, rather than rush it out the door. Stock KSP doesn't actually need the upsides of Unity 5 urgently, but can benefit from them in the long term, with a careful and considered transition to it.
